step1.para: If previously removed, install the bearing inner race on the front of each countershaft ( Figure 246).

figure.caption: Figure 245. Install Bearing Inner Race on Front of Each Countershaft

step1.para:
IMPORTANT: On the low range gear of each auxiliary countershaft assembly, locate the "O" stamped on one tooth. Align tooth with "O," with smaller deep reduction gear tooth and mark the tooth with highly visible toolmaker's dye
( Figure 247).

figure.caption: Figure 246. Align Tooth With "O" With Smaller Deep Reduction Tooth and Mark Tooth

step1.para: Place one countershaft into position in the housing, meshing the marked tooth of the countershaft gear with either set of two marked teeth of the mainshaft deep reduction gear ( inset, Figure 248). Center rear of the countershaft in the bearing bore, start rear bearing in bore and complete installation with a flanged-end driver and maul. Repeat the procedure with the other auxiliary countershaft assembly, making sure the deep reduction gear set remains in time during bearing installation.

figure.caption: Figure 247. Place One Countershaft into Position, and Start Rear Bearing in Bore

note.para: Check synchronizer assembly for springs that may be released during bearing installation.

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the groove at the rear of each countershaft ( Figure 249).

figure.caption: Figure 248. Install Snap Ring in Groove at Countershaft Rear

step1.para: Position the new gasket on the cover mounting surface and install both rear bearing covers ( Figure 250). Tighten bolts to secure covers to auxiliary housing.

figure.caption: Figure 249. Install Both Rear Bearing Covers
